item.title: Storm drain blocked, 2nd March
item.description:
On the junction between Old Road and Sunset Lane the drain is blocked causing water to continually flow down the road - extremely dangerous in cold weather as the surface freezes which will cause car accidents and pedestrian falls

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sunset Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: Bad repair to a drain, 2nd March
item.description:
Repair around drAin close to Murco petrol station has come up. Deep hole around entire perimeter of drain. What3words location norms.maddening.lump

item.title: New road layout dangerous, 2nd March
item.description:
The junction causes multiple risk to users. from Sainsbury side the split left-right is too narrow causing vehicles turning right to swerve because of centre reservation which means they essentially enter the left hand turn side. The lane widths do not suit modern vehicles. The whole layout needs review from all directions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Fence inappropriate for cycle way, 2nd March
item.description:
This is a signposted cycle way but the three fence slalom is far too tight, you cannot navigate it without dismounting if your bike has some luggage weight and many cargo bikes would be too long to even fit through it. I understand it is to stop motorbikes and cars using the path but the current solution obstructs many bikes which are meant to be using this pathway. The fences need spacing further apart or one of the three simply needs removing. We should be encouraging cycling after all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welveland Lane, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Revolting public toilets, 2nd March
item.description:
Considering the local and international appeal of Pittville Park, due to visitors to the park and historic Pump Room, the public toilets are a blight on our towns landscape. They stink at all times, and dilapidated. Can this be urgently rectified before summer 2025. It would take 4 weeks with the RIGHT contractor to gut these toilets and refurbish them. There is no major building works needed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road after failing utilities repair, 2nd March
item.description:
The long stretch of poorly repaired utility trnech has a deep hole forming in it. The location on the road is very dangerous for cyclists and made harder by the busy nature of the road next to a nursery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Winter mud, compost and general refuse, 2nd March
item.description:
Whole of Pittville Crescent Lane needs street sweeper. It's piled with over 12 to 18 months of decayed vegetation and mud
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Pittville Crescent, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water constantly leaking across the junction, causing slippery driving conditions, 2nd March
item.description:
Water is flowing down the slope and across the junction. This is causing the junction to be very slippery - icy conditions today due temperature of zero degrees. Cars coming from the golden Valley roundabout direction, have to brake in order to turn right, towards the airport. Even when approaching cautiously, the car skidded as it turned right across the junction. This water problem has been there for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same
